snippet: The rebels say they will wait for the government forces to stop shooting before they agree to the cease-fire brokered by Kofi Annan, a United Nations-appointed emissary.
abstract: Syrian government agrees to withdraw its security forces from in and around major population centers by April 10, ostensibly paving way for a general cease-fire two days later.

byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar reported from the United Nations, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Steven Lee Myers from Istanbul; Anne Barnard and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon; and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: The rebels say they will wait for the government forces to stop shooting before they agree to the cease-fire brokered by Kofi Annan, a United Nations-appointed emissary.

headline.seo: Syria Commits to April 10 Withdrawal Plan
headline.main: Syria Agrees to Troop Withdrawal, Annan Says
headline.print_headline: Syria Commits to April 10 Deadline for Pulling Troops, Envoy Says

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
